data.event: Originally named Richardville County, it was rechristened in 1844 to commemorate General Tilghman Ashurst Howard.
In 1846, the name was changed to Howard County, in honor of Gen. Tilghman Howard, U.S. Representative from Indiana, who died in 1844.
In 1846, the name was changed to Howard County, in honor of Gen. Tilghman Howard, U.S. Representative from Indiana, who died in 1844.

data.event: Kokomo Reservoir (Wildcat Creek Reservoir) Western Days Festival: First week of June, in Russiaville, Indiana Howard County 4-H Fair [1], in Greentown, Indiana Koh-Koh-Mah & Foster Living History Encampment, mid-September Kokomo-Howard County Public Library Walk Of Excellence - serves the city of Kokomo.
